directions: We used a slow cooker for this recipe, which will take approx. 6 hours. If using stove top just use the lowest heat available to simmer, timings will have to be adjusted. It is ready when meat is tender.
Preheat 1 tbsp. olive oil and brown meat, approx. 4 mins, spoon onto plate and set aside.
Heat remaining olive oil, 1 tbsp, and sauté onion, approx. 5 mins or until softened. Add Beef back to pan and with garlic, paprika, Worcestershire sauce and barley. Sauté 1 min.
Add beef stock and 2 cups water, thyme and pepper. Simmer for 3 hours, stirring occasionally.
After 3 hours, add potato and carrot. You will need to add more water as the barley would have soaked up a lot of the liquid. Simmer a further 2 hours.
Now add mushrooms, a little more water might be needed. Taste, you can add more pepper and thyme or garlic to suit your taste. Simmer a further hour.
Serve or leave until next day so flavours all incorporate.
ingredients: 1 large carrot or 2 med, cut into large chunks
2 large mushrooms or 6 button mushroom, chopped
title: Beef and Barley Soup Recipe
